title: Lincoln Boyhood National Memorial: For Kids
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     For Kids              For Kids       Junior Ranger Program Kids of all ages can take part in the Junior Ranger Program at Lincoln Boyhood. Complete fun activities, participate in programs at the farm, and take the junior ranger pledge to earn a signed certificate and badge. Learn more about the Junior Ranger program. Visit the Memorial Visitor Center The memorial building was built to remember Abraham Lincoln and his mother Nancy Hanks Lincoln. The sculptured panels on the front of the building show significant periods in Abraham Lincoln's life. The museum helps you uncover information about Abraham Lincoln, his family, boyhood and frontier life in Indiana. The story of Lincoln's youth is told in "Forging Greatness: Lincoln in Indiana", the 15 minute park orientation film. Visit the Living Historical Farm The farm Living Historical Farm is a working pioneer homestead with a log cabin, outbuildings, split rail fences, animals, gardens and crop fields. The buildings are open from mid-April through September. Go for a Hike or Bike Ride The park has 2 miles of nature trails for hiking. You may ride your bike on park roads.
